task.title: Stopping Pipelines
task.shortdesc: Stop pipelines when you want to stop processing data for the pipelines.

context.p: pipelinesstoppingWhen runs a pipeline, it displays in the console in Monitor mode by default.

step.cmd: From the Home page, select the pipelines in the list and then click the Stop icon. Or to stop a pipeline in the pipeline canvas, click the Stop icon.
step.info: The Stop Pipeline Confirmation dialog box appears.

step.cmd: To stop the pipelines, click Yes.
step.info:
If a pipeline remains in a Stopping state, you can force to stop the pipeline immediately.
In some situations, a pipeline can remain in a Stopping state for up to five minutes. For example, if a scripting processor in the pipeline includes code with a timed wait or an infinite loop, waits for five minutes before forcing the pipeline to stop.

step.cmd: To force a pipeline to stop from the Home page, click the More icon for the pipeline, and then click Force Stop. Or to force a pipeline to stop from the pipeline canvas, click Force Stop.
step.info: The Force Stop Pipeline Confirmation dialog box appears.

step.cmd: To force the pipelines to stop, click Yes.
